author: Legal Correspondent
text:
The Supreme Court on Wednesday agreed to hear a petition filed by BJP leader Subramanian Swamy, challenging the former Chief Justice of India R.M. Lodha Committee's decision to suspend IPL franchisee Chennai Super Kings (CSK) for two years over the 2013 betting scam involving its top official Gurunath Meiyappan.

Dr. Swamy also sought a stay on further auction of the players of CSK and the second suspended IPL team, Rajasthan Royals, till the Supreme Court takes a final decision on placing further bids on his petition.

A Bench led by Chief Justice of India T.S. Thakur agreed to fix a date for hearing of the petition, which said the PIL filed by Cricket Association of Bihar through its office-bearer Aditya Verma was a fraud.

‘In public interest’

Dr. Swamy said if the auction was allowed to continue, many “iconic players” would enter into contracts with the other teams and the CSK players would be lost forever.

“Public interest demands that Chennai and cricket lovers across the country, especially residents of Tamil Nadu, ought not to be deprived of their beloved CSK for no fault of its players on the basis of a sponsored, vitiated and fraudulent litigation,” the petition said.
title: Apex court to hear plea against CSK suspension
